name: Bulls
notes: Put cards in rows in increasing numerical order to get rid of cards and force opponent to take them. Lowest score wins.

name: Flora
notes: Create sets of floral cards in tiled sequences to connect the same species of flower.  Highest score wins.

name: Blue
notes: Choose colored tiles to place on board in matching colors with extra points for specific patterns and sets.  Highest score wins.

name: Backgammon
notes: Classic strategy game.  Move checkers around a board to reach home while avoiding capture.  First to remove all own pieces wins.

name: Going Nuts
notes: Play letter tiles in crossword pattern until all tiles are used. First to play valid words and run out of tiles wins.

name: Stratagem
notes: Place colored shapes onto board with corners touching.  Fewest unit squares remaning wins.

name: Bhukhar
notes: Team game in Rummy family.  Cards played in sets or sequences earn points according to card value.  Team with most points wins.

name: Zookeeper
notes: Collect animal cards and play in order picked up. Trade cards to improve hand. Collect coins based on strength of play. Most coins at end of game wins.

name: Whisky Cat
notes: Move tokens from home around board to target area using card powers.  First to move all pieces to target wins.

name: Bus Driver
notes: A drinking game where players make guesses about face down cards.

name: Foreign Affairs
notes: Place tiles around tables based on country and gender. Earn points for proper seating arrangements and lose points for unused tiles. Highest score wins.

name: Feline
notes: Build a quilt using colorful hexagon tiles. Each player uses their own board. Gain points for matching patterns and colors. Most points wins.

name: Cities
notes: Tile-building game where players create and link farmland, cities, and roads to earn points. Optional 4 expansion packs with additional tiles, scoring system, and rules available and built-in to the main game.

name: Checkers
notes: Classic strategy game, also known as draughts.  Move pieces diagonally around board.  First to capture all opponent pieces wins.

name: Chess
notes: Classic strategy game.  Move pawns, queens, rooks, etc. in defined patterns around board. First to capture opponent king piece wins.

name: Downtown
notes: Get ownership of sections of city block through luck and negotiation and build matching business through six rounds.  Most money wins.

name: Chinese Checkers
notes: Jump over own or opponent pieces to move to opposite side of board.  First to relocate all 10 pieces wins.

name: Chinese Chess
notes: Classic strategy game.  Move pieces in defined patterns around intersecting lines on board. First to capture opponent general/marshal piece wins.

name: Undercover
notes: Team leader gives team member clues so they can guess words.  First team to guess all words without getting the assasin card wins.

name: Undercover Duo
notes: Cooperative word guessing game.  Give your partner clues to guess words without getting the assasin card.

name: Quad Line
notes: Stack checkers in columns to link 4 horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.  First to connect four in a row wins.

name: Quad Line 3D
notes: Stack checkers in 3-dimensional columns to link 4 horizontally, vertically, or diagonally.  First to connect four in a row wins.

name: Diplomacy
notes: Use card powers to influence other players.  Tell the truth, lie, or steal to gain advantage.  Last player with an influence card remaining wins.

name: The Team
similar name: The Crew: The Quest for Planet Nine
notes: Cooperative trick taking card game. Work together on mission tasks to ensure that certain tricks are taken by certain players, all while not revealing your hand.

name: The Team II
notes: Cooperative trick taking card game. Work together on mission tasks to ensure that certain tricks are taken by certain players, all while not revealing your hand.

name: Ultra
notes: One player on each of two teams provides clues about code words. Players attempt to correctly match clue with the code word. Teams try to guess their own codes and the other team's codes.  Play up to 8 rounds, but winner declared after two failures or two intercepts.

name: Dominoes
notes: Classic tile-based strategy game using dominoes with 0 to 6 pips.  Multiple rule variations and winning conditions.

name: Dots
notes: Add lines to complete squares.  Most completed squares wins.

name: Duel 52
notes: Use card powers to remove opponent cards on three lanes on the board.  First player to control two lanes wins.

name: Durak
notes: Alternate attacking and defending moves with cards to beating lower ranked cards and force opponent to take extra cards.  Last player to have cards in hand loses.

name: Pennsylvania Rush
notes: Use deck of 40 cards in 4 suit colors and 2 genders. Play cards in ascending order and color into common piles. Earn points for playing cards and lose points for remaining cards. Most points wins.

name: Forces of Nature
notes: Use a 16 card deck consisting of numbers 1 to 6. During turn, either play, draw, discard, knock, or fold. Goal is have higher sum than opponent but equal or less than sum played on table. Winner of each round gets 1 or 2 points. First player to 6 points wins.

name: Crossed
notes: Take turns rolling dice to figure out which sections on scoresheet to mark off. Player rolling dice can remove two dice and other players choose from remaining dice. Highest score wins.

name: Don't Blow Up
notes: Take turns drawing cards, using card powers to avoid getting the explosion card.  First player to get explosion card loses.

name: Tantrums
notes: Place shaped pieces on board to fill in as many spaces as possible, but leaving designated scoring spaces open.  Highest score wins.

name: Go
notes: Classic strategy game.  Take turns placing black and white pieces on intersection of board.  Player controlling most territory wins.

name: Interrogation
notes: Take turns asking characteristics questions about photos to deduce the secret person your opponent has been assigned. First person to guess correctly wins.

name: Speedy Fruits
notes: Flip cards to reveal matching fruits and ring bell when 5 of a kind are displayed to win opponent cards.  Player with most cards wins.

name: Fireworks
notes: Cooperative card tile laying game.  Work together to complete the pattern before running out of cards and while never looking at your own cards.

name: Hangman
notes: Guess letters to complete a word before the hangman image is filled in.

name: Animal Race
notes: Move around board by collecting and spending carrots and lettuce.  First around the board having depleted all lettuce and all but 10 carrots wins.

name: Hearts
notes: Classic trick-taking card game where players try to avoid taking hearts and the queen of spades. When one player reaches agreed maximum score, player with fewest points wins.

name: Meta
notes: Collect pieces to score points. The more pieces that match the patterns (all the same, all different, multiple pairs, etc.), the more points the player earns. During turn, draw a piece and play it or put it in communal area. Most points wins.

name: Bug Chess
notes: Place hexagon tiles with bug images, with each bug moving in unique ways, to control the board. First player to surround opponent's queen wins.

name: Starship Pyramids
notes: Abstract, free-form strategy game using upright pyramids and pyramids laying on their side. Use different size and color pyramids to represent star systems and starships. Win by destroying opponent's home star or all ships at opponent's home star.

name: Tittle
notes: Place cards in tile pattern on board matching 4 shapes and 4 colors.  Player with most points wins.

name: Find the Word
notes: Players secretly choose a 5-letter word. Opponents take turns guessing letters one at a time and to find out if letter is in the secret word and clues about its position. First to guess opponent's word wins.

name: Best Guess
notes: Cooperative game where one player guesses word based on clues provided by other players. Try to get as many correct as possible.

name: Lost Temples
notes: Tile-laying race game. Players start with identical empty boards and each place the same piece and move tokens to be the first to reach temples and collect treasure. Player with most points wins.

name: Shattered Dominion
notes: Place tiles consisting of images of various types of terrain to connect to a matching type of terrain already on the 5x5 board. Earn points for connecting tiles and playing bonus symbol. Most points wins.

name: Moving Walls
notes: Shift tiles on board to complete maze pattern to collect treasure and block opponents.  First to collect treasure pieces wins.

name: Moving Walls 3D
notes: Shift tiles on 3D board to complete a pattern to collect treasure and block opponents.  First to collect treasure pieces wins.

name: Liar's Dice
notes: Make claims about value of rolled dice to bluff opponents and get them to challenge.  Lose dice if caught in a lie.  Last player with dice wins.

name: Alpaca
notes: Start with 6 cards and get rid of as many cards as possible. To play, must play same number as top card or one higher. Round ends when one player empties hand of cards or all players quit. Fewest points once another player reaches 40 points wins.

name: Expeditions
notes: Play cards into columns in ascending numerical order. Gamble with wager cards that will multiply your positive or negative score. Highest score wins.

name: Courting
notes: Start with one card. Then draw a card and play a card. Use card powers to expose others and knock them out of the game. First player to win designated number of rounds (4-7 based on number of players) wins.

name: Mahjong
notes: Traditional Chinese game using illustrated tiles. Take turns drawing from stock pile or other players' discards to create sets and runs from tiles in hand. Play until all tiles used then start another round. Highest score wins.

name: Mancala
notes: Move marbles around pits in board to collect your own and opponents marbles.  Player with most marbles wins.

name: Pairs
notes: Remember where items are hidden to successfully make matches and win pairs.  Player with most matching pairs wins.

name: It's Just a Game, Chill
notes: Move tokens around board according to roll of dice.  First player to get all tokens to home wins.

name: Mexican Train
notes: Use double 6, 9, 12, or 15 dominoes depending on number of players. Starting from a common domino, play a domino that matches a previous end of the train. Play on own train, other players trains when available, or on a common Mexican train. Lowest points after desiganted number of rounds wins.

name: Road Race
notes: Play cards with various distance values until one player reaches exactly 1,000 kilometers. Play stop sign, accident, fuel, speed limit, and flat tire cards to limit opponents' travel and corresponding repair cards to resume your own travel. Highest score wins.

name: Telepathy
notes: Cooperative game where cards 1-100 must be revealed in lowest to highest order. Players may not communicate and as there is no order of play, players must get a sense of when to play and when to wait.  Team wins if all levels completed before losing its last life.

name: Nine Men's Morris
notes: Place and slide pieces to intersections of board to make lines of three and remove opponents piece.  First player to have 2 pieces remaining loses.

name: Ninety-Nine
notes: Trick taking card game using part of your hand to declare bid.  Most points wins.

name: Ich mag keine Karten
notes: Play with deck of cards numbered 3-35. Cards worth their face value, but lower if in a run. During turn, either play a chip to avoid taking a card, or pick up and play the face up card and gain chips played on it. After playing 24 cards, lowest score wins.

name: Reversi
notes: Classic strategy game using two-sided discs on an 8x8 board placed to try and capture opponent pieces. Player with most of colored discs on board wins.

name: Tic-Tac-Toe-Tye
notes: Classic game of X's and O's with a twist; 3 different size markers fit in each square.  Link 3 colored tokens in one of 3 ways to win.

name: Flatten the Curve
notes: Cooperative game where players move around board to eliminate diseases. Players win by curing all four diseases and lose if diseases spread too far or cures take too long.

name: Crafty
notes: Placed shaped pieces on board to fill in spaces while balancing cost of pieces and token position on progress board.  Most points wins.

name: Spin 5
notes: Place marble into a space on four connected and rotating 3x3 grids. Connect five marbles in a row to win.

name: Dix Cards
notes: Complete a series of levels by laying down cards in runs, sets, or colors.  First to complete 10 levels wins.

name: Dix Dice
notes: Complete a series of levels by rolling dice in runs, sets, or colors.  First to complete 10 levels wins.

name: You Can't Draw
notes: Teams take turns assigning player to draw a word. Other team members have one minute to guess what player is drawing. If guess correct, roll dice and move around board. If guess wrong, next team draws. First team to reach end of board wins.

name: Imagination
notes: Players are assigned a random card to recreate each using different components. Players vote on which picture was recreated and points awarded for correct guesses. Most points after 5 rounds wins.

name: Poker
notes: Use regular deck of 52 cards to form hands higher than opponents, or bluff them into believing your hand is higher.  Multiple rule variations and winning conditions.

name: Alleys
notes: Build walls to create corridors to move token and to block opponent.  First to cross to other side of board wins.

name: Shape Sorter
notes: Place blocks in patterns on board while matching 6 shapes and 6 colors.  Player with most points wins.

name: Diced
notes: Roll colored and white dice to mark off scoresheet with boxes of 2-12 trying to get as many boxes as possible.  Highest score wins.

name: Rackball
notes: Using 60 card deck, exchange one card each turn to improve hand. Be first to arrange 10 cards from lowest to highest in hand. First to 500 points wins.

name: Reward
notes: Move armies around board using dice rolls to conquer territory.  Player who conquers all 42 territories wins.

name: Crow
notes: Classic trick taking card game using 4 suited deck with cards 1-14 and a bird card.

name: Rummy Tiles
notes: Rearrange the tiles to make sets and runs. First to play all their tiles wins.

name: Adedanha
notes: Starting with a random letter, list words in designated categories.  First to complete list wins.

name: Yoink!
notes: Play with deck with value 1-10 on one end and different 1-10 value on the other end. Once hand is dealt, cannot move cards but can rotate once. Then play sets or runs using cards in dealt order in your hand that are are higher than what opponent played. Play number of rounds equal to number of players. Highest score wins.

name: Wordy
notes: Use letter tiles to build words with extra points for playing in certain locations.  Most points wins.

name: Stacker
notes: Build shared stacks of cards, deciding whether to play from hand, discard pile, or stockpile. Player that empties personal stockpile first wins.

name: Oasis
notes: Players start with 4 cards. Play cards face down until one player challenges. Highest bidder then flips stated number of cards. If player flips all 'good' cards and no 'bad' ones, player wins challenge. First player to win two challenges wins.

name: Roar
notes: Trick-taking card game with 15 cards in 5 suits. Points lost for not taking exact number of bids.  One player serves as a foil and instead of taking tricks, tries to force other players to take them.  Fewest penalty points at end of game wins.

name: Solitaire
notes: Collection of classic solitare card games, each with its own rules and game mechanics.

name: Spades
notes: Classic trick-taking card game using spades as trumps. Bid anticipated number of tricks and score based on how well players do. First to agreed-upon point total wins.

name: Elemental
notes: Bluffing card game. Play or pass each turn while declaring card. Penalties for getting caught lieing and wrong challenges. Collect reward cards for points.  Most points wins.

name: Splendid
notes: Buy cards and gems to collect points.  First player to 15 points wins.

name: Impostor
notes: One player randomly assigned as impostor and all other players look at image showing a location. Players ask questions to try and figure out which player is the impostor. Impostor scores points for guessing location. Other players score points for identifying imposter. Highest score after agreed upon number of rounds wins.

name: Capture the Flag
notes: Strategically arrange movable army pieces, bombs, and flag on board. Attack and capture opponents pieces. First to capture opponent's flag wins.

name: Tutti Frutti
notes: Players choose a card from their hand to play face up, then pass the remaining cards. Repeat until all cards are played. Earn points by collecting sets of cards or being player with most of certain card. Most points after 3 rounds wins.

name: Tangrams
notes: Solo puzzle game.  Use triangles, a square, and a parallelogram to make designs.

name: Connex
notes: Place colored, shaped blocks into playing area to connect as many pieces as possible to earn points and block opponents.  Highest score wins.

name: Medieval VNO
notes: Play cards onto discard stack matching color or number.  Use cards with powers to influence play.  First to get rid of all cards wins.

name: Fantasy Wars
notes: Choose and place tokens with special powers to fight for space on board with hexagon shaped areas.  First player who places designated tokes in specific spaces wins.

name: Magician
notes: Trick taking, trump card game using a deck of 60 cards where players must take exact number of tricks bid and 8 cards have special rules.  Most points wins.

name: Five of a Kind
notes: Classic dice game. Roll dice up to three times to complete designated tasks on scorecard. Highest score wins.

name: -----Tutorials Follow-----
notes: Tutorials are demo files for developers. They are not games.

name: Arrays
notes: 6 Variants: Creating, Evaluating, Modifying - Basic, Modifying - Advanced, Example: Random Word, Example: Moving Widget

name: Button Appearance
notes: 4 Variants: Introduction, Text Only, Images, CSS Shapes

name: Comparisons
notes: 2 Variants: Alphanumeric, Logical

name: CSS
notes: 4 Variants: Basic, Advanced, Caution, Cards

name: Enlarge
notes: 2 Variants: Basic, Cards

name: Functions - CLICK
notes: 2 Variants: Basic, Modes

name: Functions - GET
notes: 2 Variants: Basic, Virtual Properties

name: Functions - SELECT
notes: 3 Variants: Basic, Relation, Mode and Rank

name: Functions - SORT
notes: 5 Variants: Introduction, Inbuilt Keys, Sequential, Reversing, Poker Hands

name: Grids
notes: 4 Variants: Tiling, Area Limit, Hexagonal Grids, Changing Properties

name: Hands
notes: 3 Variants: Direct Deal, Custom Visibility, Seats

name: Hexagonal Cards
notes: 3 Variants: Basics, Grid, Demo

name: Holders
notes: 5 Variants: Appearance, Offset Basic, Offset Advanced, Moving Basic, Moving Advanced

name: Math
notes: 5 Variants: Basic, Constants, Advanced, Randomization, Format

name: Menus
notes: 2 Variants: Basic, Advanced

name: Piles
notes: 3 Variants: Basic, Advanced, Decoration

name: Routines
notes: 5 Variants: Intro and clickRoutine, enterRoutine and leaveRoutine, changeRoutine, globalUpdateRoutine, clickRoutine Equivalents

name: Seats
notes: 4 variants: Basic, Advanced, Turns, and Board Demo

name: Skip
notes: 2 Variants: Occupied Holders, Used Buttons

name: Spinners
notes: 6 Variants: Basics, Recoloring, Customizing the Arrow, Custom Background, Styling Examples, Automations

name: State Dependent Routines
notes: 3 Variants: Custom states, Inbuilt states, Example: Self Locking Button

name: Strings
notes: 4 Variants: Creating, Evaluating, Modifying, Example: CSS

name: Timer
notes: 3 Variants: Basics, Card Deal Animation, Appearance

name: ------Assets Follow------
notes: Assets are widgets and other items for developers. They are not games.

name: Decks
notes: 6 Variants: Default, Pixel Art, Minimalist, Big Symbols, Domino (Skinny Cards), Grim Pixel Art

name: Symbols
notes: Recommended standard symbols for VTT games

name: Other Widgets
notes: 5 Variants: Game Pieces, Game Boards, Buttons, Crystals, Misc Tools
